alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 4:10AM AKST until December 24 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM AKST THIS MORNING FOR THE SOUTHERN BRISTOL BAY COAST... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Visibility reduced to one half mile at times. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Northwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay coast from Pilot Point to Port Heiden. * WHEN...Until 11 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow showers and gusty northwesterly winds are reducing visibility along the southern Bristol Bay coast. The worst conditions will be around Pilot Point and are expected to continue through the morning hours. As winds gradually decrease later this morning, visibility will improve.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
